problem_state_summary: The problem involves two diagrams showing pure samples of gas in identical closed, rigid containers. Each colored ball in the diagrams represents one gas particle. The task is to compare the average kinetic energies and temperatures of the particles in each sample. Both samples have the same number of particles. The problem asks which sample has the higher temperature, with the understanding that average kinetic energy is related to temperature. The options provided are: neither sample has a higher temperature, sample A has a higher temperature, or sample B has a higher temperature.
unknowns: average kinetic energy of sample A
average kinetic energy of sample B
required_operations: Visually compare the diagrams to assess the distribution and movement of gas particles
Determine the average kinetic energy of particles in each sample
Relate average kinetic energy to temperature
Map findings to the provided options
blockers: average kinetic energy of sample A
average kinetic energy of sample B
risk_checks: Ensure label-to-segment mapping is clear in the diagram
Verify that the visual representation accurately reflects differences in kinetic energy

options.label: A
options.text: neither; the samples have the same temperature

multiple_choice.answer_format: Return final as option label or exact value per instruction
